result.execSummary:
The defendant Phillip J Komosa was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Victim/Dissuade Reporting, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.44(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime work/fultlime school and when not fully engaged must complete 10 hours community service per week.
No contact with V.L. & L.L. unless approved by agent/

Assessment, treatment, and counseling as recommended. 
Defendant may be eligible for early release from probation after 1 year if criteria is met.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

State appears by ADA Mike Puerner:
Defendant appears in person and with Atty Peter Karoblis;
VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to file an Amended Information.
Ct. 1 (Stangulation or Suffocation)>>DRI.
COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA: 
Ct. 2 (Misdemeanor Intimidate Victim)>> NO CONTEST.
Ct. 3 (Battery)>> NO CONTEST.
Ct. 4 (DC)>> NO CONTEST.

Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: Sentence W/H- 2 Years Probation on each Count, concurrent. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, Maintain Full time work/Full time school and when not fully engaged must complete 10 hours of Community Service per week, No Contact with V.L. and L.L. unless approved by agent, Court Costs, NO DNA Sample and Surcharge. Defendant may be eligible for early release from probation after 1 year if criteria is met. 

COURT DOES NOT restrict Defendant from Firearms and no restrictions on alcohol use.
